intro: Arachnitis uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower lily, is a rare and striking plant native to the wetlands of eastern Australia. It is characterized by its unique, solitary white flower that sits atop a slender, leafless stem. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often submerged in water, adapting it to its aquatic or semi-aquatic habitat. Arachnitis uniflora is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its ephemeral blooming cycle, often flowering only during specific wet seasons. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
